EmailTemplate.subject: Turbonomic Top Ten Features #3: Supply Chain
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{Lead.First Name}},
Here is your third Turbonomic Top Ten Feature: Supply Chain. Of course, if at any time you want to accelerate your learning, you can visit the Green Circle Community <[[https://greencircle.turbonomic.com/welcome?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-HybridCloud&utm_content=Mid03]]> and gain tips and tricks from real Turbonomic customers and evaluators just like you. Feature #3: Supply Chain
Turbonomic abstracts and represents the data center and all its entities as a supply chain of buyers and sellers of resources. The output of their transactions is a series of Actions that guarantee performance. The Supply Chain shows their relationships, and helps you answer the following questions:
- What are the relationships among all entities in my environment? - Which ones need attention?
Step-By-Step: Supply Chain
The following steps will guide you through the Supply Chain tab:
- Navigator arrows represent the Buyer-Seller relationships between types of entities - Click any entity type in the Navigator to populate this section with all the entities in that class; Red = Overutilized, Green = Desired Utilization, Blue = Underutilized - Click any entity in the Navigator to populate the Related section with details about the selected item and its supply chain
- The purple box represents the current Utilization Index (UI)* and the green box represents the Utilization Index after related actions in the To Do section are executed
- Utilization plots the utilization levels for each resource consumed by the selected entity, over time. Slide the carrots to adjust the time period displayed by the plot.
*Utilization Index (UI) is Turbonomic's calculation of the relative price of an entity in the data center. UI ranges from 1 to 20,000.
